history.content:
You need to contact the instructors and ask if they would accept undergrads in their classes. Different 294 courses may have different enrollment policies at the discretion of the instructors. If the instructor consents that you may take the class, you can get a permission code for the class, and if you want to take multiple 294 classes, you would need a permission code for each one of them. 

Sometimes instructors post on this piazza if they receive too many emails, but I don't expect all 294 classes to post, so maybe still email individual instructors instead of waiting for a post.

children.subject: who's teaching 294: RL and empirical processes? I wasn't able to find the prof's contact information. Thanks!

history.content: I was looking around on the Berkeley course catalog and noticed several super interesting CS294 classes, but haven't seen any posts on Piazza for Fall 2020 confirming whether these would be open to undergraduate students.
history.subject: Will grad level special topics courses (CS 294) be open to undergrads this fall?
